oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Nutrition Management Programs for Dairy Herds
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Nordlund, Ken
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: nutrition management
dairy herd health program
production with health
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: My concept of a dairy herd health program consisted of a well defined reproductive program, a somewhat confused vaccination program, and some rather vague ideas about rearing calves and controlling mastitis. That concept has changed. The best people in our profession have reshaped herd health into something much more capable of dealing with problems limiting dairy production. The emphasis has changed from health toward production with health.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1982; 35-40
